metadata.title: CVE-2023-46813 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 6.5.9, exploitable bylocal users with userspace access to MMIO registers. Incorrect accesschecking in the #VC handler and instruction emulation of the SEV-ESemulation of MMIO accesses could lead to arbitrary write access to kernelmemory (and thus privilege escalation). This depends on a race conditionthrough which userspace can replace an instruction before the #VC handlerreads it.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-46813` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-94-generic - 5.15.0-94.104
linux-image-5.15.0-94-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-94.104
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-94-generic - 5.15.0-94.104
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-94-generic-64k - 5.15.0-94.104
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1050-kvm - 5.15.0-1050.55
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1053-aws - 5.15.0-1053.58
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1051-gcp - 5.15.0-1051.59
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1050-gke - 5.15.0-1050.55
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1036-gkeop - 5.15.0-1036.42
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1046-ibm - 5.15.0-1046.49
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1047-intel-iotg - 5.15.0-1047.53
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1044-nvidia - 5.15.0-1044.44
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1044-nvidia-lowlatency - 5.15.0-1044.44
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1051-oracle - 5.15.0-1051.57

No subscription required

No subscription required
